div1.p: King sends Moran a program of the memorial session of the American Public Health Association

div1.head: Letter from William F. King to John J. Moran, October 17, 1933
div1.opener:
AMERICAN PUBLIC
HEALTH ASSOCIATION
President
JOHN A. FERRELL, M. D.
61 Broadway, New York
Acting Secretary
KENDALL EMERSON, M. D.
450 Seventh Avenue, New York
INDIANAPOLIS LOCAL
COMMITTEE
General Chairman
WM. F. KING, M. D.
225 Wimmer Building
General Secretary
HENRY T. DAVIS
225 Wimmer Building
SIXTY-SECOND ANNUAL MEETING
OF THE
American Public Health Association
INDIANAPOLIS, INDIANA
October 9-12, 1933
October 17,
1933.
John J. Moran,
Care of Cia Sunoco de Cuba,
Ave Monocal No. 1o2-A,
Havana, Cuba.
My dear Mr. Moran:-
div1.p:
I am sending you the program of the
Memorial session and banquet held by the American Public
Health Association at Indianapolis, Indiana, to honor
Walter Reed and those associated with him in the Yellow
Fever Investigations at Havana, Cuba in 1900 and 1901.

It was a wonderful meeting with more
than five hundred people in attendance. We were greatly
honored in having with us four of the volunteers who took
part in the investigations; namely, Dr. Robert P. Cooke of
Lexington, Virginia. Levi E. Folk of Columbus, Ohio, Charles
G. Sonntag of Gaston, South Carolina and John R. Kissinger of
Huntington, Indiana.

It was a great occasion and the four
comrades who were here had a most wonderful time together.

I hope you will enjoy having this program
which is being sent to you with the best wishes of the American
Public Health Association and of the Indianapolis Committee, for
health and happiness and all good things that life can bestow.
May I add to this my personal greeting and best wishes.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely and cordially yours, Wm. F. King, M.D.,
General Chairman,
509 Blue Ridge Road,
Indianapolis, Indiana. WFK-EEH.
